contentrichtext.text: '''Mara''' may refer to: {{wiktionary|Mara|mara}} {{tocright}} ==Social groups== *[[Mara people]], in northeastern India and western Myanmar * [[Mara language]], a language spoken by Mara people *[[Mara Salvatrucha]], a violent criminal gang in Mexico, Central America, Canada, and the United States *[[Mukkulathor#Maravar|Maravar]], a dominant caste in Tamil Nadu state in India * [[Mara (Tagin)]], a tribe in Arunachal Pradesh ==People== *[[Mara (name)]], list of people with this name ==Places== * [[Mara District]], Cotabambas, Peru * [[Mara, Iran]], a village in Iran * [[Mara, Kerman]], a village in Iran * The Mara, or [[Maasai Mara National Reserve]], Kenya *[[Mara, Tanzania]], an administrative region of Tanzania *[[Mara (SS)]], a commune on the Italian island of Sardinia *[[Mara, South Africa]], a small town in South Africa *[[Mara River (Iza)]], a river in Romania *Mara, a village in [[Desești]] Commune, Maramureş County, Romania *[[Mara (torrent)]], a stream of Italy and Switzerland *[[Mara River]], a river of Kenya and Tanzania *[[Masai Mara]], a reserve in Kenya near the Mara River *[[Mara, Spain]], a municipality *[[Marado|Mara-do]], an island of South Korea ==Culture== *[[Mara (goddess)]], from Latvian mythology *[[Mara (folklore)]], a specter or wraith-like creature in Germanic and particularly Scandinavian folklore *Mara, also [[Marzanna]], Murava, Morana, Moréna or Morena, in Slavic peoples mythology, the goddess of darkness, death, winter, the Moon and horror *[[Mara (Hindu goddess)]], the goddess of death according to Hindu mythology *[[Mara (demon)]], a "demon" of the Buddhist cosmology, the personification of Temptation *Sri Mara or Mara [[Varma]], an honorific title of the Pandya kings of south India *In Hindu mythology, a mantra told to [[Valmiki]] to chant *Mara, an abbreviation of [[Mayura (mythology)|Mayura]] (Sanskrit word for peacock) ==Fiction== * The [[Mara (Doctor Who)]], an evil being in two ''Doctor Who'' serials * In the [[Childe Cycle]] of Gordon R. Dickson, one of the two homeworlds of the Exotics * [[Mara Jade]], a female assassin for [[Emperor Palpatine]] who later marries [[Luke Skywalker]] in the [[Star Wars Expanded Universe]] ==Organisations== * [[Majlis Amanah Rakyat]], literally People's Trust Council, a government-linked company in Malaysia * [[Migration Agents Registration Authority]] an Australian organisation that registers and monitors Migration Agents * [[Dance Club Mara]], a formation dance team, Minsk, Belarus * [[Mara (supermarket)]], a Romanian supermarket chain ==Other== * [[Mara (mammal)]], a species of the cavy family * [[Mara the Lioness]], animal actor in the movie ''Born Free'' * [[Mara (album)|''Mara'' (album)]], a 1995 album by Scottish band Runrig * "Mara", a song by [[Country Joe and the Fish]] * Mara (Calophyllum calaba) de la familia Clusiaceae.REPUBLICA DOMINICANA ==See also== * [[Maras (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation|geo}}
